clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Study of Escitalopram Oxalate Combined With taVNS in Depression and Concomitant Inflammatory Symptoms
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical Study of Escitalopram Oxalate Combined With Transcutaneous Vagus Nerve Stimulation in the Treatment of Depression and Concomitant Inflammatory Symptoms

brief_summary.textblock: This study is expected to include 90 patients with major depressive disorder and rheumatoid arthritis as study subjects.Randomly divided into 3 groups: drug + VNS stimulation group, drug + sham stimulation group and drug group, each group had 30 patients.The treatment period of each group was 8 weeks.Age and sex were matched in all three groups.Scale evaluation and inflammatory factor test were performed before treatment (baseline), at week 4 and week 8 after treatment.Head MRI, evoked potential, and electrocardiogram were performed at baseline and at the end of week 8.

detailed_description.textblock:
1. Drug +VNS stimulation group: both VNS and escitalopram oxalate tablets were treated for 2 months. VNS stimulation was treated once a day for 30 minutes at the intensity of 1-2mA. Drug treatment: the dose of escitalopram oxalate tablets was maintained at 10-20 mg/ day
2. Drug + sham stimulation group: the patients were treated with escitalopram oxalate tablets and sham VNS for 2 months. Sham VNS stimulation: the sham stimulation device automatically stops after 30 seconds of stimulation. Drug treatment was the same as the above group.
3. Drug group: the dose of escitalopram oxalate tablets was maintained at 10-20 mg/ day without VNS stimulation

primary_outcome.measure: Changes of Hamd-17 Scale Scores From Baseline to Week 8
primary_outcome.time_frame: From the baseline to the week 8
primary_outcome.description: After 8 weeks of treatment, the rate of hamd-17 scale score was decreased compared with the baseline

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Hamd-17 Scale Scores from Baseline to Week 4
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of hamd-17 scale scores from baseline to the end of treatment at week 4

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of MADRS Scale and SDS Scale Score from Baseline to Week 4 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to week 4 and week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Changes of MADRS SDS scale scores from baseline after the end of treatment at week 4 and week 8

secondary_outcome.measure: The Clinical Improvement Rate at Week 4 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to week 4 and week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Clinical improvement rates at week 4 and 8 (50% reduction in hamd-17 or MADRS from baseline)

secondary_outcome.measure: The Remission Rate after 8 Weeks' Treatment
secondary_outcome.description: Hamd-17 or MADRS scores are less than or equal to 7

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes of Cytokines from Baseline to Week 4 and Week 8
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to week 4 and week 8
secondary_outcome.description: Changes in cytokines such as TNF-α, IL-γ, IL-4, IL-8 and IL-10 from baseline to the end of treatment after week 4 and week 8
